entry.def: Overtime is time that you spend doing your job in addition to your normal working hours.

example.ex: He would work overtime, without pay, to finish a job...
example.tran: 他会为了完成工作无偿加班。

example.ex: Union leaders had urged miners to vote in favour of an overtime ban.
example.tran: 工会领导人呼吁矿工投票支持加班禁令。

entry.def: If you say that someone is working overtime to do something, you mean that they are using a lot of energy, effort, or enthusiasm trying to do it.

example.ex: We had to battle very hard and our defence worked overtime to keep us in the game...
example.tran: 我们不得不奋力搏杀；为保证我们不被淘汰出局，防守队员拼尽了全力。

example.ex: She works overtime with her vacuum cleaner to keep grit out of the kitchen.
example.tran: 她动用真空吸尘器力争不让厨房出现沙砾。

entry.tran: （体育比赛中为决胜负而延长的）加时赛
entry.def: Overtime is an additional period of time that is added to the end of a sports match in which the two teams are level, as a way of allowing one of the teams to win.

example.ex: Denver had won the championship by defeating the Cleveland Browns 23-20 in overtime.
example.tran: 丹佛队在加时赛中以23比20击败克利夫兰布朗队夺得冠军。

means.word_mean: 1. work done in addition to regular working hours
2. playing time beyond regulation, to break a tie

means.word_mean: 超出的时间;额外的时间

sentences.en: He was paid for the overtime he worked.
There was nothing to worry about. It was just her imagination working overtime.
sentences.cn: 不用担心。这只是她在疯狂幻想而已。

sentences.en: They are working overtime to finish the work.
sentences.cn: 为了完成任务他们正在加班加点地工作。
